revised_title: Discovery and Description of Holtenia, a New Genus of Vitreous Sponges
tldr: The author describes the discovery and characteristics of Holtenia, a new genus of vitreous sponges, found during a deep-sea dredging cruise. The sponge has a unique structure with large separate siliceous spicules forming a stellate appearance and a delicate network of sarcode-threads. The author also discusses the three types of spicules found in the sponge and their role in its structure.
